:''This article is about the United States. For similar objects worldwide, see [[Nuclear briefcase]]''
:''This article is about the United States. For similar objects worldwide, see [[Nuclear briefcase]]''
â
The '''Nuclear Football''' (also called the '''Atomic Football''', '''President's Emergency Satchel''', '''The Button''', '''The Red Button''' the wang button, '''The Black Box''', or just '''The Football''') is a black [[briefcase]], the contents of which are to be used by the [[President of the United States|President]] of the [[United States|United States of America]] to authorize a [[Nuclear warfare|nuclear attack]] while away from fixed [[command center]]s, such as the [[White House Situation Room]]. It functions as a mobile hub in the strategic defense system of the United States.
+
The '''Nuclear Football''' (also called the '''Atomic Football''', '''President's Emergency Satchel''', '''The Button''', '''The Red Button''', '''The Black Box''', or just '''The Football''') is a black [[briefcase]], the contents of which are to be used by the [[President of the United States|President]] of the [[United States|United States of America]] to authorize a [[Nuclear warfare|nuclear attack]] while away from fixed [[command center]]s, such as the [[White House Situation Room]]. It functions as a mobile hub in the strategic defense system of the United States.
